summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) waiver form used to document that an employee is voluntarily providing information as part of an investigation. It includes warnings, assurances, and signature blocks for the employee, OIG special agent, and a witness.

persons.name: OIG Special Agent
persons.context: The OIG Special Agent is the investigator who would be conducting the voluntary interview and whose name would be filled in on the form.

persons.name: Employee
persons.context: The employee is the individual voluntarily providing information as part of an OIG investigation, as indicated by the signature block.

persons.name: Witness
persons.context: A witness who observes the signing of the voluntary interview waiver form.

connections.description: The OIG Special Agent is conducting a voluntary interview of the Employee as part of an investigation.

keyFacts: This is a standard Department of Justice OIG form (OIG Form III-226/2) for documenting a voluntary employee interview.
The form explicitly states the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, and any statements may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The form requires signatures from the employee, an OIG special agent, and a witness, along with the date, time, and place of signing.
